title: How to Make Stuffing

steps.headline: Brown the sausage.
steps.description: Heat skillet over medium high heat, and add the sausage to the pan. Use a fork to break it up while it cooks. Keep cooking it until it's completely browned, then remove the cooked sausage to a plate lined with paper towels to drain.

steps.headline: Heat the butter in a large pan over medium heat.
steps.description: You can use a big dutch oven, a deep skillet, or another pan large enough to hold all of the ingredients.

steps.headline: Dice the onion and celery.
Sauté the onion and celery.
steps.description: Stir them with a wooden spoon until the onions become translucent.

steps.headline: Add the dried bread crumbs and broth.
steps.description: Stir the mixture well so that the bread crumbs begin to absorb the broth.

steps.headline: Stir in the spices.
Add the sausage.
Mix in the white bread pieces.
Remove the stuffing from heat and let it sit.
steps.description: If the stuffing seems too dry, mix in another 1/2 cup of broth. If the stuffing seems too wet, add more pieces of bread.

methods.name: Baking the Stuffing Inside a Turkey

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.
Get the turkey ready.
steps.description: Remove the neck and giblets from inside the cavity of a thawed turkey. Rinse the cavity with cold water and pat the outside dry with a paper towel.

steps.headline: Scoop stuffing into the neck cavity.
steps.description: Use a spoon to pack it in, then pull the skin over the stuffing and seal with small skewers.

steps.headline: Fill the large cavity with stuffing.
steps.description: Seal the opening shut in the same manner as the neck cavity. If there's not enough skin to cover the stuffing, tie the legs together or place a piece of bread over the stuffing to hold it in.

steps.headline: Roast the turkey for the correct time.
steps.description: As a general rule, a stuffed bird will need to cook for 20 minutes per pound. Check the temperature by inserting a meat before removing the turkey from the oven. The thigh should be 180 °F (82 °C), and the breast should be 170 °F (77 °C).

steps.headline: Leave the turkey to rest for 20 minutes before removing the stuffing.
steps.description: Serve the stuffing in a separate dish.

methods.name: Baking the Stuffing in a Casserole Dish

steps.headline: Grease the inside of a casserole dish.
Scoop the stuffing into the dish and press down lightly.
Pour another 1/2 - 1 cup of stock over the stuffing to keep it moist during baking.
Cover the dish with foil.
Bake at 350 °F (177 °C) for 20 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake another 15 - 20 minutes.
Remove the stuffing from the oven when the top is golden brown and crispy.
